reference.title: SQL Scrapbook
reference.shortdesc: From the SQL Scrapbook views (you can have multiple SQL Scrapbook views) you can enter and execute arbitrary SQL. This allows you to perform more complex SQL operations than you can with the UI controls provided by the MOTODEV Database perspective.

section.p: The SQL Scrapbook view is divided into two parts. The upper portion contains the Connection profile and identifies the database to which the view is connected (if any). The lower part is a single large text field into which you enter your SQL statements.
The Connection profile consists of the following fields:

strow.stentry: Database type. For instance, SQLITE_3.5.9. The type is automatically filled in when you connect to a database from the SQL Scrapbook view.
Full name of the connection profile. For instance, myAVD.com.motorola.example.database.books. Select a profile from this list to connect to it.
Database status. For instance, Connected, Auto Commit

section.p: You must be connected to a database from within the Connection profile to be able to execute SQL statements.

To execute a single SQL statement, enter the statement in the large text area, or right-click in this area and select Edit in SQL Query Builder to construct your SQL query statement interactively. Then, right-click the statement and select Execute Current Text. Note that you can execute all of the SQL statements in the text are with Execute All, or a set of statements by selecting them and then selecting one of the Execute Selected Text commands from the context-sensitive menu.
The execution results appear in the SQL Results view.
section.note: The SQL Scrapbook is not connected to the MOTODEV Database Explorer; if the MOTODEV Database Explorer is opened when you run a command in the SQL Scrapbook view, any database changes that result from that command are not automatically reflected in the MOTODEV Database Explorer. You will need to manually refresh the MOTODEV Database Explorer view to see the changes.
